Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer in the ninth inning against Devin Williams, catapulting the Mets to a 4-2 victory over the Brewers in Game 3 of the NL Wild Card Series.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets won their first postseason series since 2015.
David Stearns said, 'There was no way this season was going to end without something happening in that ninth inning.'
Steve Cohen said, 'I don’t think a Hollywood scriptwriter could have written a better ending.'
Carlos Mendoza said, 'We continue to believe.', 'As a team we’ve been punched and knocked down and continue to find ways to get back up.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pete Alonso hit a home run in the ninth inning.
Francisco Lindor walked and Brandon Nimmo singled with one out before Alonso hit the homer.
The Mets got an insurance run in the ninth on Starling Marte’s RBI single after Jesse Winker was plunked for the second time in the game.
Jose Quintana was brilliant over six innings, allowing four hits and one walk with five strikeouts.
Edwin Diaz ended up getting five outs without surrendering a run.
Jose Iglesias and the Mets celebrated after recording the final out of Game 3.
